result.execSummary:
The defendant Christine A Gilbertson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care as well as cognitive intervention. No prescription narcotics unless approved by agent.   No contact with the co-defendant or victims family (person, property, residence or family). Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time.   Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Restitution must be paid during the term of supervision.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

CORRECTED TO MAKE RESTITUTION JOINT/SEVERAL

timeConds.notes: Must serve 4 months. Huber is granted for employment. Do not report late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances. Absolute sobriety is required.
to be completed during each year defendant is on probation

Plea/sentencing hearing on May 5, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Christine A Gilbertson in court.  Patricia J Hanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Atty Walker emailed this Courts clerk earlier today indicating she is ill and cannot be here today.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Racine County Alternatives Program
from victim's mother

Defendant Christine A Gilbertson in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
The State indicates that after speaking with the victim's mother they are not prepared to go forward today; the victim's mother saw the deft laughing and joking and is not prepared to go forward emotionally. The victim's mother hasn't had time to speak to the prosecutor assigned on this case as today is the first day she's heard the offer. Mr. Repischak feels he cannot fulfill the Ch. 950 requirements. The defense objects to the delay and indicates that this date has been set for a month; the agreement was reached and the defense objects to any futher delay. 

BTC: The adjournment request is granted  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 3, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Racine County Alternatives Program

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victims family, GKL (person, property, residence or family).   No contact with the co-defendants, RCL and RDR.     It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to be monitored by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340 in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator) between the hours of 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 17, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Christine A Gilbertson in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Defendant Christine A Gilbertson in custody.  Patricia J Hanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Defense received an offer from the State today and she believes that the deft will accept the offer. Defense asks for bond modification. The State does not object

BTC: set for COP ASAP. Modify bond to $25,000.00 signature bond; same conditions as in cash bond. Additionally, no contact with co-deft's.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2017 at 10:30 am.
